input: Anne is big. Anne is green. Anne is nice. Anne is red. Anne is rough. Anne is round. Anne is smart. Erin is big. Erin is red. Fiona is nice. Fiona is rough. Fiona is round. Fiona is smart. Gary is big. Gary is round. Gary is smart. Rough, red people are round. All round, rough people are green. Green, smart people are nice. If someone is red then they are rough. If someone is round then they are red. Green people are red. Nice people are red. Green people are smart. If someone is red then they are rough. Question: Erin is not nice.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Anne : obj
constant Erin : obj
constant Fiona : obj
constant Gary : obj

constant Big : obj → Prop
constant Green : obj → Prop
constant Nice : obj → Prop
constant Red : obj → Prop
constant Rough : obj → Prop
constant Round : obj → Prop
constant Smart : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Big Anne
axiom T2 : Green Anne
axiom T3 : Nice Anne
axiom T4 : Red Anne
axiom T5 : Rough Anne
axiom T6 : Round Anne
axiom T7 : Smart Anne
axiom T8 : Big Erin
axiom T9 : Red Erin
axiom T10 : Nice Fiona
axiom T11 : Rough Fiona
axiom T12 : Round Fiona
axiom T13 : Smart Fiona
axiom T14 : Big Gary
axiom T15 : Round Gary
axiom T16 : Smart Gary

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Rough x ∧ Red x → Round x
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Round x ∧ Rough x → Green x
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Green x ∧ Smart x → Nice x
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Red x → Rough x
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Round x → Red x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Green x → Red x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Nice x → Red x
axiom R8 : ∀ x : obj, Green x → Smart x
axiom R9 : ∀ x : obj, Red x → Rough x

theorem erin_is_not_nice : ¬ Nice Erin :=
begin
  sorry
end

-- Looks like it cannot be proven in Lean.
-- So let's try to prove the negation of the theorem, which is Erin is nice

theorem erin_is_nice : Nice Erin :=
begin
  apply R3,
  split,
  apply R2,
  split,
  apply R1,
  split,
  exact T9,
  apply R4,
  exact T9,
  apply R5,
  apply R1,
  split,
  exact T9,
  apply R4,
  exact T9,
  apply R8,
  apply R2,
  split,
  apply R1,
  split,
  exact T9,
  apply R4,
  exact T9,
  apply R5,
  apply R1,
  split,
  exact T9,
  apply R4,
  exact T9,
end

-- It can be proven in Lean. So
-- The answer is False
